title: At the time of independence, we were the world's sixth-largest economy. What all we could have done differently so that it wouldn't have took us 75 years just to become the fifth-largest economy in the world?
selftext:
We were the world's 6th largest economy during the independence. Then the Hindu Rate of Growth 'cause of our experiments with socialism which included nationalization of industries and strict government regulation, severely limited foreign investment, hindered private sector growth and innovation dragged us to being world's 12th largest economy by 1990.

Do you think if Indian governments had if India had pursued economic liberalization policies earlier, such as reducing government intervention and encouraging foreign investment, it may have experienced faster economic growth. And we could have easily been top 3 or 2 largest economy by now?

https://www.ft.com/content/dec674c5-9009-4da1-a857-c2e68473c9ae
